revised_title: Selective Admission of Antitoxins by Foetal Membranes in Rabbits
tldr: The study investigates how the foetal membranes of rabbits selectively admit antitoxins from different species into the foetal circulation. It shows that the concentration of antitoxin in the foetal serum varies depending on the species in which the antitoxin was produced. The entry of rabbit antitoxin into the foetal circulation increases with foetal age and decreases thereafter. This selective admission by the foetal membranes is crucial for the development and protection of the unborn rabbit.
